triples.name: Echo chamber
triples.relevance: Core concept studied - the paper analyzes how echo chambers form on different social media platforms.

triples.name: Social media
triples.relevance: The paper performs comparative analysis across social media platforms to study their information dynamics.

triples.name: Homophily
triples.relevance: A key dimension analyzed in the paper - measuring homophily in interaction networks across platforms.

triples.name: Diffusion of innovations
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes information diffusion bias toward like-minded peers as a mechanism for echo chamber formation.

triples.name: Gab
triples.relevance: One of the four social media platforms analyzed in the comparative study.

triples.name: Facebook
triples.relevance: One of the four social media platforms analyzed; shows higher segregation in news consumption compared to Reddit.

triples.name: Reddit
triples.relevance: One of the four social media platforms analyzed; compared with Facebook on news consumption segregation.

triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: One of the four social media platforms analyzed in the comparative study.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: The methodological approach used to analyze homophily and information dynamics in social networks.

triples.name: Comparative analysis
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and implements a novel comparative analysis framework across multiple social media platforms to identify platform-specific echo chamber dynamics.
